descriptionNullable:
_____
# NYS Adult Health Care Coverage
### Percentages of Insured Residents 2007-2010
By Health Data New York [[source]](https://data.world/healthdatany)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset provides valuable insights into the health care coverage status of adult non-institutionalized residents across New York State between 2007 and 2010. The Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) is a random digit dialing (RDD) phone survey highlighting the health status, behaviors, and insurance coverage among adult NYS residents. Utilizing the data collected from these surveys, this dataset presents an estimated percentage of the population with/without health insurance coverage in accordance with key demographic and geographic characteristics such as sex, race/ethnicity, age groupings, education levels, income brackets, limitation statuses (e.g., physical limitations), employment status and mental health statuses. Upon review of this data set one can gain understanding about potential issues that may exist within certain communities relating to access to healthcare amongst other important topics. Before using the data set it’s important to read through this dataset’s Terms of Service to understand its license requirements for proper use

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> This dataset provides annual percentages of non-institutionalized adult (18+) NYS residents with/without health insurance coverage from 2007 to 2010. It contains data for a range of demographic and geographic categories including sex, race/ethnicity, age, education, income, limitation status, employment status, and mental health status. 
> 
> Using this dataset can assist you in answering questions such as “What is the percentage of adults over 18 in New York State without health care coverage?” or “How has the percentage of adults with health care coverage changed over time?” 
> 
> To use this dataset effectively: 
> - Read through the Terms of Service prior to using the data 
> - Identify your desired outcome(s) so you know what questions you need to answer 3. Assess each column - explore its content and purpose so that you understand all components relevant for your analysis 4. Filter the data to focus on the specific categories needed for your research 5. Calculate percentages or groupings when necessary 6. Visualize your findings 8 Use additional datasets when necessary 9 Check accuracy by validating against outside sources 10 Communicate results concisely

### Research Ideas
> - Analyzing regional disparities in health care coverage based on demographic categories.
> - Investigating how changes in income levels are associated with increased or decreased access to health care coverage over time.
> - Determining the effectiveness of various initiatives meant to increase access to health care services and coverage, such as Medicaid expansion measures

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/healthdatany)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> See the dataset description for more information.

### Columns

**File: health-care-coverage-status-brfss-2007-2010-1.csv**
| Column name                                  | Description                                                       |
|:---------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Characteristic**                           | The characteristic being measured. (String)                       |
| **Year**                                     | The year the data was collected. (Integer)                        |
| **Demographic Category**                     | The demographic category being measured. (String)                 |
| **Demographic Group**                        | The demographic group being measured. (String)                    |
| **Overall Sample Size**                      | The total sample size of the population. (Integer)                |
| **Overall Population Size**                  | The total population size of the population. (Integer)            |
| **Sample Cases with Characteristic**         | The number of sample cases with the characteristic. (Integer)     |
| **Estimated Population with Characteristic** | The estimated population with the characteristic. (Integer)       |
| **Percentage with Characteristic**           | The percentage of the population with the characteristic. (Float) |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [Health Data New York](https://data.world/healthdatany).
